org.megatome.frame2.event
Interface Context

public interface Context

A context wraps request and session scope data in a protocol neutral fashion. The event handler can use this wrapper to place and retrieve data from the underlying protocol request and session objects. The context also provides access to the request Errors object. This object accumulates error data regarding the request such that it may be provided back to the client.

Method Detail

getInitParameter

String getInitParameter(String key)
Returns the initialization parameter for the event handler. The initialization parameters are specified for a specific handler in the configuration. The context will contain the specific initialization parameters for a handler when the handler's handle method is called.

Parameters:
key - The key of the parameter as configured. If no parameter has been configured for the key then null is returned.
Returns:
String The configured value for that key.

getRequestAttribute

Object getRequestAttribute(String key)
Returns the value of the named request attribute as an Object, or null if no attribute of the given key exists.

Parameters:
key - The key of the request attribute to look up.
Returns:
The value associated with the key, or null if there is none.

setRequestAttribute

void setRequestAttribute(String key,
                         Object value)
Stores an attribute in the request. Attributes are reset between requests. If an object of the same name is already bound to the session, the object is replaced.

Parameters:
key - The key this attribute will be stored under.
value - The value to associate with the key.

setRequestAttribute

void setRequestAttribute(String key,
                         Object value,
                         boolean redirectAttr)
Stores an attribute in the request and the key in the ContextImpl List. Attributes are reset between requests. If an object of the same name is already bound to the session, the object is replaced.

Parameters:
key - The key this attribute will be stored under.
value - The value to associate with the key.
redirectAttr - If true, sets this key and value into the redirect attributes as well.

removeRequestAttribute

void removeRequestAttribute(String key)
Removes an attribute from the request.

Parameters:
key - The key of the object to remove.

getSessionAttribute

Object getSessionAttribute(String key)
Returns the value of the named session attribute as an Object, or null if no attribute of the given key exists.

Parameters:
key - The key of the attribute to look up.
Returns:
The value associated with the key, or null if none found.

setSessionAttribute

void setSessionAttribute(String key,
                         Object value)
Stores an attribute in the session. If an object of the same name is already bound to the session, the object is replaced. requests.

Parameters:
key - The key the value is to be stored under.
value - The value to be associated with the key.

removeSessionAttribute

void removeSessionAttribute(String key)
Removes an attribute from the session.

Parameters:
key - The key of the attribute to remove.

Errors getRequestErrors()
Returns the errors object for this request.

Returns:
An Errors object
See Also:
Errors

getServletContext

ServletContext getServletContext()
Return the servlet context

Returns:
The current servlet context
See Also:
ServletContext

addResponseURIAttribute

void addResponseURIAttribute(String key,
                             Object value)
Add an attribute that can be passed on to another event in the chain. If the desired result is to chain to an event while setting its "item" field to "1234", the key used would be "item" and the value "1234"

Parameters:
key - Key to store the attribute under. Should correspond to a field on an event in the chain.
value - Value to set for the field.

hasResponseURIAttributes

boolean hasResponseURIAttributes()
Determine if there are any attributes that should be added to the response by the framework.

Returns:
True if there are any response attributes

getResponseURIAttributes

Map<String,Object> getResponseURIAttributes()
Get all current response attributes

Returns:
Map of attributes

clearResponseURIAttributes

void clearResponseURIAttributes()
Remove all response attributes.

removeResponseURIAttribute

void removeResponseURIAttribute(String key)
Remove an attribute.

Parameters:
key - Key of attribute to remove. Does nothing if the key does not exist or is null.
